name: React Universe Conf
description: Join thousands of developers at the Moscone Center for a deep dive into the React ecosystem. This year's conference focuses on the stability of React 19, the evolution of Server Components, and real-world case studies on migrating massive codebases to modern architectural patterns. Attendees will engage with core team members and industry leaders through interactive Q&A sessions and hands-on networking hubs designed to solve complex frontend scaling issues.

name: Global Open Source Hackathon
description: A 48-hour global marathon bringing together contributors of all skill levels to improve the open-source software we rely on every day. Participants will be matched with mentors from major projects in the JavaScript, Python, and Rust communities. The event focuses on closing critical security issues, improving documentation, and building new features that promote digital equity and accessibility across the global tech landscape.

name: TypeScript & Tea Meetup
description: An intimate evening designed for the London developer community to discuss the nuances of static typing over artisanal tea. This meetup features three lightning talks covering advanced utility types, the integration of TypeScript with legacy Express apps, and a look at the latest compiler API features. It's the perfect environment for networking and sharing project blockers with some of the brightest minds in the UK's TypeScript scene.

name: Rust Systems Summit
description: The Rust Systems Summit is a technical deep-dive into high-performance, memory-safe systems programming. We will explore the latest advancements in the Borrow Checker, asynchronous programming patterns, and the growing role of Rust in the Linux kernel and embedded systems. This summit is specifically tailored for engineers looking to push the boundaries of performance and reliability in mission-critical infrastructure.

schedule.activity: Deep Dive: Memory Safety at Scale
schedule.speaker: Niko Matsakis

name: Next.js Edge Workshop
description: Transition from standard SSR to the Edge. This intensive workshop focuses on leveraging the Next.js Edge Runtime to provide personalized, low-latency experiences for global users. You will learn how to implement complex middleware logic, handle dynamic routing at the edge, and optimize your data-fetching strategies to achieve near-instantaneous Page Insights scores while maintaining a highly scalable and cost-effective cloud architecture.

name: Backend Scalability Forum
description: As user bases grow, backend challenges multiply. This forum gathers lead architects from top tech firms to discuss the shift from monoliths to microservices, the implementation of event-driven architectures, and the nuances of horizontal scaling. Expect technical sessions on Kubernetes orchestration, database sharding strategies, and observability tools that help maintain high availability during massive global traffic spikes.

name: AI & LLM Integration Day
description: Explore the practical side of the AI revolution. Rather than focusing on high-level theory, this day-long event focuses on how to actually integrate Large Language Models into existing software products. Sessions cover Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques, cost-optimization for API calls, and the ethical considerations of deploying AI-driven features to production. This is a must-attend for product engineers and CTOs.

name: Web3 Builders Retreat
description: Combine professional growth with the serenity of Bali. This retreat is designed for serious Web3 developers to step back from the screen and discuss the long-term vision of decentralized protocols. Topics include the evolution of Layer 2 solutions, cross-chain interoperability, and the future of Governance DAOs. The schedule balances high-level brainstorming sessions with community-building activities in a tropical, collaborative setting.

name: Cybersecurity CTF Finals
description: The final showdown of a year-long competitive hacking series. Watch the top-ranked security researchers and penetration testers face off in a live environment. The challenges involve real-world vulnerabilities in web applications, network protocols, and cryptographic systems. Spectators can follow the action on live leaderboards with expert commentary, making this a thrilling educational event for security enthusiasts.
